intro.speaker: Kana
intro.line: Ah! What a lovely day! I might just break out in song! And twirl all the day long! Hmm. But Papa/Mama is visiting today, and I haven’t seen him/her in such a long time. I’d better do something special for him/her. Gather some fruit? Fish for fish? Ha, I know! Papa/Mama should have both. So I’d better get going!

intro.speaker: Kana
intro.line: Wh-who are you? Y-you look weird! Get away from me!

intro.speaker: Kana
intro.line: Umm, what do you all want? You’d better not be here to make trouble. My papa/mama will be here soon! They’re not listening. But I can’t just run. They look ready to do evil things!

intro.speaker: Kana
intro.line: Oof!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Phew! Here in the nick of time. Are you all right, Kana?

intro.speaker: Kana
intro.line: P-Papa/M-Mama?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I’m so sorry, Kana. You’ve been safe here for so long. I never thought anyone would come here to hurt you. Please tell me you’re OK!

intro.speaker: Kana
intro.line: Yeah, Papa/Mama.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Thank the gods. Now, off with you. Your papa/mama has everything in hand. YOU! You dare touch my child?! I'll soak these fields with your blood!

intro.speaker: Kana
intro.line: Papa/Mama, there are too many of them!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I'll protect you, Kana. But don't worry about me. I told you to run! Now, the rest of you! Prepare to join your comrades in death!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: They’re tough... But I have to... keep them away from...

intro.speaker: Kana
intro.line: No! You bunch of bullies! Stop hurting Papa/Mama!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Kana! How many times do I need to tell you?! Run!

intro.speaker: Kana
intro.line: No! I’m not going to leave, Papa/Mama! Not when I’ve waited so long to see you again! No one’s going to take you from me! I’m staying right—rrgg! Right here by—RRRG! By your—RRAWRGH!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Kana?! You're...

intro.speaker: Kana
intro.line: RRAAAAWRG!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: It can't be. She/He shouldn't have the ability to—

intro.speaker: Kana
intro.line: RRRAWWRRGGRR!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: No...she/he must have inherited it from me. But for it to awaken here, now? She's/He's out of control. This...this must be her/his first time transforming! She's/He's at risk of losing herself/himself to a mindless rampage in the face of these foes! Friends, join me! We must clear the field of this menace—fast!

battle.speaker: Llewelyn
battle.line: Mwahaha. What have we here, Lloyd?

battle.speaker: Llewelyn
battle.line: It's plain as the nose on your face. Can't you see it over there?

battle.speaker: Llewelyn
battle.line: I dunno, my nearsighted brother. Maybe I mean that dragon yonder?

battle.speaker: Llewelyn
battle.line: No, you addle-brained baboon. I mean that dragon way OVER yonder.

battle.speaker: Lloyd
battle.line: Why didn't you say so? Dragons are like gods! We should catch it!

battle.speaker: Llewelyn
battle.line: Yes. We'll make it our pet. A god on a leash! But let's proceed sensibly. We must pummel it to the brink of death. But what SHOULD we name it...?

boss.speaker: Lloyd
boss.line: That dragon's mine! I'm going to name it Llizardface!

end.speaker: Kana
end.line: Whuh... whuh... What... What happened, Papa/Mama? I dreamed that I turned into a dragon!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Yes, well... You did, Kana.

end.speaker: Kana
end.line: I did? For real? You look upset, Papa/Mama. I didn’t mean to do it, I only wanted to protect you! But I’m small. And I felt... useless. Then I felt myself get so angry. I heard a roaring in my head... It got louder and louder, until I couldn’t hear myself thinking anymore. I’m sorry. I didn’t mean to turn into a dragon. Am I in trouble now?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: No! Far from it. You’ve made me the happiest father/mother in the world. I turn into a dragon too.

end.speaker: Kana
end.line: What? Papa/Mama, you–?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Listen, Kana. I’m sorry that I haven’t visited you enough to explain... But I keep my power in control by using very special stones. You must too. Or else the dragon within may take over. Don’t be scared – you just need a stone. Azura has given me a stone that you can use. Carry this with you always.

end.speaker: Kana
end.line: Thank you. It’s such a beautiful stone. I’ll treasure it, Papa/Mama! But now that I can turn into a dragon... can I maybe travel with you?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I’m so sorry, Kana. But you’re too young. And my world is too dangerous.

end.speaker: Kana
end.line: No, Papa/Mama? I guess I can wait longer, but only if you promise to visit more often.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Oh... Of course. I promise. Cross my heart and hope to— Er, I promise—that’s all. And I’ll be sure to bring you a nice gift next time I come.

end.speaker: Kana
end.line: Yeah... All right, Papa/Mama.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: That’s my girl/boy. Be good, Kana, and you keep hanging on to that stone!

end.speaker: Kana
end.line: ...Hmpf. No, Papa/Mama. WAIT!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Kana, I have to go. A lot of people are depending on your papa/mama.

end.speaker: Kana
end.line: I... I know! That’s why I have to go with you! I’m depending on you too... to come back! And I never know if you’ll... if you’ll... If you’ll DIE and never come back! What if I grow old enough to leave here, but by then you’re gone?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Kana, I’m only trying to protect you! But if that’s how you feel... If it’s agony for you being here? That’s the last thing I want. Maybe... All right. You’re coming. With your new powers, you might be safer with me. I need to explain all of this to my friends. You need to say good-bye to yours.

end.speaker: Kana
end.line: What, I get to come with you? Really?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Yes, really. But, Kana, it’s a different world out there. It’s not a game – it’s scary. I’ll look after you. Still, are you sure you’re grown-up enough for this?

end.speaker: Kana
end.line: Well... I’m only a little kid. But I’m old enough to be a dragon. And my papa’s/mama's one too.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Like father, like daughter/Like mother, like son. I guess there’s a lot we should catch up about.

end.speaker: Kana
end.line: Yes! I can’t wait! Papa/Mama, I have to say one more thing before we leave. Rrrghg rawrgghh rrrh! That's dragon for I love you!
